about.description: duhh-mov is a fork of movie web. They shutdown so I am here PRIVATELY. duhh-mov runs on a private, self-hosted VPS. No profit is made from this shit either because I don't like money apparently. Fuck Ads, get pussy.

q1.body: duhh-mov does not host any content. When you click on something to watch, the internet is searched for the selected media (On the loading screen and in the 'video sources' tab you can see which source you're using). Media never gets uploaded by duhh-mov, everything is through this searching mechanism.
q1.title: Where does the content come from?

q2.body: It's not possible to request a show or movie, duhh-mov does not manage any content. All content is viewed through sources on the internet.
q2.title: Where can I request a show or movie?

q3.body: Our search results are powered by The Movie Database (TMDB) and display regardless of whether our sources actually have the content.
q3.title: The search results display the show or movie, why can't I play it?

q4.body: All data is synced to the sudo-backend which is different than the community backend and is independently hosted by Badmevv, anyone is free to use this as well.
q4.title: What about my data and stuff?

q5.title: How can I find out more?

preferences.thumbnailDescription: Most of the time, videos don't have thumbnails. You can enable this setting to generate them on the fly but they can make your video slower.
preferences.autoplayDescription: Automatically play the next episode in a series after reaching the end. Can be enabled by users with the browser extension, a custom proxy, or with the default setup if allowed by the host.
preferences.sourceOrderDescription: Drag and drop to reorder sources. This will determine the order in which sources are checked for the media you are trying to watch. If a source is greyed out, it means it is not available on your device.
